gzip-size

Get the gzipped size of a string or buffer

Install

sh $ npm install --save gzip-size

Usage

```js var gzipSize = require(‘gzip-size’); var string = ‘Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.’;

console.log(string.length); //=> 191

console.log(gzipSize.sync(string)); //=> 78 ```

API

gzipSize(input, callback)

input

Required
Type: string, buffer

callback(err, size)

Required
Type: function

gzipSize.sync(input)

Returns the size.

input

Required
Type: string, buffer

CLI

sh $ npm install --global gzip-size

```sh $ gzip-size –help

Usage gzip-size cat | gzip-size

Example gzip-size index.js 211 ```

Tip

Combine it with pretty-bytes to get a human readable output:

sh $ pretty-bytes $(gzip-size jquery.min.js) 29.34 kB
